intro: Paepalanthus fastigiatus, commonly known as the upright arrowroot plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded, moist environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant.
